documents.title: Welcome to Dokploy | Dokploy
documents.description: Dokploy is a open source alternative to Heroku, Vercel, and Netlify.
documents.summary: This document introduces Dokploy as an open-source, self-hostable deployment platform that simplifies application and database management using Docker and Traefik.

documents.title: Features | Dokploy
documents.description: Explore the comprehensive suite of features available in Dokploy for optimized application deployment and management.
documents.summary: This document outlines the core features and management capabilities of Dokploy for deploying applications, Docker Compose setups, and databases. It covers essential operations like monitoring, environment configuration, domain management, and automated backups.

documents.title: Architecture of Dokploy | Dokploy
documents.description: Overview of the core architecture components of Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document outlines the core architectural components of Dokploy, explaining how Next.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, and Traefik work together to facilitate application deployment and scaling.

documents.title: Installation | Dokploy
documents.description: Get Dokploy up and running on your server within minutes with this easy-to-follow installation guide.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide for installing Dokploy on a server, covering system requirements, installation commands, and initial security configurations.

documents.title: Comparison | Dokploy
documents.description: A comparison of Dokploy, CapRover, Dokku, and Coolify
documents.summary: This document provides a detailed feature comparison between several self-hosted deployment platforms including Dokploy, CapRover, Dokku, and Coolify.

documents.title: Reset Password & 2FA | Dokploy
documents.description: Reset your password to access your Dokploy account and disable 2FA.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for resetting a Dokploy account password and disabling two-factor authentication through the command-line interface of the Docker container.

documents.title: Uninstall | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to uninstall Dokploy on your server
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for completely removing Dokploy and its associated Docker components, including services, volumes, networks, and system files from a server.

documents.title: Manual Installation | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to manually install Dokploy on your server.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions and a comprehensive Bash script for manually installing and configuring Dokploy on a Linux server using Docker Swarm.

documents.title: Goodies | Dokploy
documents.description: Dokploy has certain goodies that are external that can be used with Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document provides a list of community-contributed external tools, integrations, and resources that can be used to enhance and automate Dokploy deployments.

documents.title: Monitoring | Dokploy
documents.description: Monitor your applications and servers with Dokploy
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and manage monitoring for servers and applications within Dokploy, covering setup prerequisites, metrics collection settings, and alert thresholds.

documents.title: Troubleshooting | Dokploy
documents.description: Solve the most common problems that occur when using Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document provides troubleshooting solutions for common issues in Dokploy, including domain connectivity, Docker volume mounting, and Traefik routing configurations.

documents.title: SSH Keys | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your SSH keys to access your servers or clone Private Repositories.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure and manage SSH keys in Dokploy for accessing private repositories and remote servers.

documents.title: Backups | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to create and restore backups of your Dokploy applications and services.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on how to create, schedule, and restore backups for Dokploy applications and services using S3 storage.

documents.title: Dokploy Cloud | Dokploy
documents.description: Deploy your apps to multiple servers remotely without worrying about the underlying infrastructure.
documents.summary: This document explains Dokploy Cloud's multi-server deployment capabilities, highlighting its ability to manage remote instances across various cloud providers for improved scalability.

documents.title: Registry | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your registry settings to store your images and artifacts.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and connect a Docker Registry to Dokploy to manage image storage and authentication credentials.

documents.title: Certificates | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your certificates to secure your applications.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manually manage and configure SSL certificates within the Dokploy UI to secure applications and enable HTTPS via Traefik.

documents.title: Environment Variables | Dokploy
documents.description: Dokploy allows you to create and manage shared and service-level environment variables for your projects and environments.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and manage environment variables at the project, environment, and service levels within Dokploy, including how to reference shared values across services.

documents.title: Domains | Dokploy
documents.description: This section outlines how to configure domains for your applications in Dokploy, ensuring that your applications are accessible via custom URLs.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up and manage custom domains for applications and Docker Compose setups in Dokploy, including configuration for HTTPS and path-based routing.

documents.title: Docker Compose | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use Docker Compose with Dokploy
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate and manage applications using Docker Compose and Docker Stack within Dokploy, covering deployment methods, environment configuration, and persistent storage strategies.

documents.title: Applications | Dokploy
documents.description: Explore the multiple deployment methods available in Dokploy, including GitHub, Git, Docker, and automated deployments via webhooks.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of how to manage and deploy applications in Dokploy, covering configuration, monitoring, and advanced orchestration settings.

documents.title: Databases | Dokploy
documents.description: Discover how to create and backup databases easily with Dokploy, supporting a variety of database systems.
documents.summary: This document explains how to create, manage, and automate backups for various database systems using Dokploy's integrated management tools and monitoring features.

documents.title: Schedule Jobs | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to automate tasks using Dokploy's Schedule Jobs feature
documents.summary: This document explains how to create and manage automated tasks in Dokploy using cron expressions across application, compose, and server environments.

documents.title: Auto Deploy | Dokploy
documents.description: Automatically deploying your application to Dokploy can be achieved through two primary methods using Webhooks or the Dokploy API. Each method supports various platforms and provides a streamlined deployment process.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up automatic deployments in Dokploy using webhooks or the Dokploy API for applications and Docker Compose services. It provides step-by-step instructions for integrating with Git providers like GitHub and GitLab, as well as DockerHub.

documents.title: Volume Backups | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to backup your volumes using Dokploy's Volume Backups feature
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure and manage automated backups for Docker named volumes in Dokploy, including restoration procedures and S3 destination setup.

documents.title: Providers | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use providers in your application or docker compose.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use various deployment providers and methods in Dokploy, covering Git integrations, Docker registries, and manual file uploads. It provides instructions for configuring access to public and private repositories using HTTPS and SSH keys.

documents.title: Cluster | Dokploy
documents.description: Manage server cluster settings.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage and scale server clusters in Dokploy using vertical and horizontal scaling techniques with Docker Swarm. It outlines the requirements for horizontal scaling, including setting up external Docker registries and managing worker and manager nodes.

documents.title: Watch Paths | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use watch paths in your application or docker compose.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure watch paths to automate deployments for applications and Docker Compose by monitoring specific file or directory changes. It details supported source control providers and provides a comprehensive guide to pattern matching syntax for defining these paths.

documents.title: Tailscale | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use Tailscale to securely access your Dokploy applications and servers through a private network without opening ports.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to integrate Tailscale with Dokploy to establish a secure private network for accessing applications and server management without exposing ports to the public internet.

documents.title: Introduction | Dokploy
documents.description: Enterprise features for SSO, whitelabeling, and audit logs
documents.summary: This document outlines available enterprise-grade features such as Single Sign-On (SSO), whitelabeling, and audit logs, providing instructions on how to request access.

documents.title: Security | Dokploy
documents.description: Security features of Dokploy
documents.summary: This document outlines the security recommendations and automated checks provided by Dokploy to help users harden their remote server environments. It covers essential configurations for firewalls, Docker integration, SSH access, and brute-force protection.

documents.title: GitHub | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure GitHub repositories for deployments. This includes setting up access tokens, repository names, and branches.
documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step guide on connecting GitHub accounts to Dokploy using a GitHub App to enable automated deployments from specific repositories and branches.

documents.title: Docker Hub | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure Docker Hub to store your images and artifacts.
documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step guide for configuring a Docker Hub registry within the Dokploy platform, including how to set up access tokens and verify the connection.

documents.title: Actions | Dokploy
documents.description: Manage S3 destinations.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage and configure S3 storage destinations for database backups, covering creation, deletion, editing, and connection testing.

documents.title: Deployments | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure and set up your remote server deployment
documents.summary: This document outlines the steps and requirements for configuring and initializing a remote server environment for application deployment.

documents.title: Gitlab | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure Gitlab repositories for deployments. This includes setting up access tokens, repository names, and branches.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for connecting GitLab repositories to Dokploy, covering authentication setup, group configuration, and the implementation of automatic deployments using webhooks.

documents.title: Cloudflare Tunnels | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use Cloudflare Tunnels to securely expose your Dokploy applications without opening ports on your server.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on how to securely expose Dokploy applications using Cloudflare Tunnels to bypass the need for open inbound firewall ports. It covers setting up the cloudflared connector, configuring SSL/TLS, and routing traffic through the Traefik reverse proxy.

documents.title: Preview Deployments | Dokploy
documents.description: Preview deployments allow you to test and review your application changes in an isolated environment before merging to production.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up and manage preview deployments in Dokploy to test application changes in isolated environments via GitHub pull requests. It covers configuration options for domains, filtering by labels, monitoring deployment status, and automated updates.

documents.title: Others | Dokploy
documents.description: This guide will cover how to configure a domain from other providers for your applications in dokploy or panel.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure custom domains from external providers for applications in Dokploy by setting up DNS A records and internal routing settings.

documents.title: Zero Downtime | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to configure zero downtime deployments in Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure zero-downtime deployments in Dokploy by implementing Docker Swarm health checks to prevent service interruptions during updates. It provides step-by-step instructions for setting up health routes and applying the necessary cluster settings.

documents.title: GHCR | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure GitHub Container Registry to store your images and artifacts.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring the GitHub Container Registry within the Dokploy platform, including authentication and token generation.

documents.title: Backups | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to schedule and manage backups for your databases in Dokploy, with options for storage in S3 buckets.
documents.summary: Explains how to configure, schedule, and test database backups in Dokploy using S3 storage destinations.

documents.title: Advanced | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use advanced features in your application.
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage advanced application settings in Dokploy, including Docker Swarm orchestration, external build server integration, and resource allocation.

documents.title: AWS S3 | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure S3 buckets for backup storage. This includes setting up access keys, secret keys, bucket names, regions, and endpoints.
documents.summary: This guide provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Amazon S3 as a backup destination, including setting up IAM policies and generating access credentials for integration.

documents.title: Google Cloud Storage | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure Google Cloud Storage buckets for backup storage. This includes setting up access keys, secret keys, bucket names, regions, and endpoints.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Google Cloud Storage as an S3-compatible backup destination using HMAC credentials.

documents.title: Okta | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure SSO with Okta (OIDC or SAML)
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for setting up Single Sign-On (SSO) integration using Okta via the OIDC or SAML protocols.

documents.title: EC2 Instructions | Dokploy
documents.description: Instructions for setting up a remote server on EC2
documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step guide for setting up an AWS EC2 remote server and connecting it to Dokploy using SSH keys for application deployment.

documents.title: Permissions | Dokploy
documents.description: Add permissions to your users to manage your applications and services.
documents.summary: This document explains the user role hierarchy and granular permission system in Dokploy, detailing the specific capabilities of Owners, Admins, and Members.

documents.title: Keycloak | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure SSO with Keycloak
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Single Sign-On (SSO) using Keycloak as an OpenID Connect provider for Dokploy. It details the setup process for both platforms, including client credentials, redirect URIs, and troubleshooting tips for common authentication issues.

documents.title: Validate | Dokploy
documents.description: Validate your remote server deployment
documents.summary: This document outlines the specific system requirements and validation steps necessary to configure deployment and build servers within the Dokploy platform.

documents.title: Azure AD (Microsoft Entra ID) | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure SSO with Azure AD / Microsoft Entra ID (OIDC or SAML)
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for setting up Single Sign-On (SSO) in Dokploy using Microsoft Entra ID via OIDC or SAML protocols. It covers application registration in Azure and the corresponding security configurations within the Dokploy dashboard.

documents.title: Build Server | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to configure a custom build server to compile your applications separately from your deployment servers.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on setting up and configuring dedicated build servers in Dokploy to separate the application compilation process from deployment environments. It covers server setup, registry integration, and the workflow for building and pushing Docker images to remote servers.

documents.title: Gitea | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure Gitea repositories for deployments. This includes setting up access tokens, repository names, and branches.
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate Gitea with Dokploy for repository access and configure webhooks to enable automated application deployments.

documents.title: License Keys | Dokploy
documents.description: Activate and manage your Enterprise license
documents.summary: This document explains how to activate a Dokploy Enterprise license and describes the daily server-side validation process used to verify license keys.

documents.title: Videos | Dokploy
documents.description: Videos about how to install and use Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document provides a curated collection of video tutorials and external resources focused on installing, configuring, and managing Dokploy for self-hosted application deployment.

documents.title: Cloudflare R2 | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure R2 buckets for backup storage. This includes setting up access keys, secret keys, bucket names, regions, and endpoints.
documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step guide for configuring Cloudflare R2 as an S3-compatible storage destination for system backups.

documents.title: Docker Registry | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your Docker Registry repositories for deployments. This includes setting up access tokens, repository names, and authentication.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure Docker Registry sources in Dokploy, providing instructions for authenticating with Docker Hub, GHCR, and other container registries.

documents.title: Connection | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to connect to your database using Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on how to configure internal and external database connections in Dokploy, including credential management and security best practices.

documents.title: Bitbucket | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure your Bitbucket repositories for deployments. This includes setting up access tokens, repository names, and branches.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for connecting Bitbucket repositories to Dokploy and setting up automatic deployments using webhooks.

documents.title: Single Sign-On (SSO) | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure SSO with Auth0, Keycloak, or other OIDC/SAML providers
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of Single Sign-On (SSO) configuration options for Enterprise users, supporting OpenID Connect (OIDC) and SAML through various identity providers.

documents.title: Utilities | Dokploy
documents.description: Utilities for your Docker Compose application
documents.summary: This document explains Dokploy's isolated deployment feature for Docker Compose, which automates network isolation to prevent service naming conflicts while maintaining Traefik routing.

documents.title: Restore | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to restore your databases in Dokploy, with options for restoring from S3 buckets.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on how to restore databases from S3 bucket backups within the Dokploy platform, including specific details for PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, and MongoDB.

documents.title: Domains | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure domains for your Docker Compose application.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure domains for Docker Compose applications using either Dokploy's native domain management UI or manual Traefik label configuration.

documents.title: Backblaze B2 | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure buckets from Backblaze B2 for backup storage. This includes setting up access keys, secret keys, bucket names, regions, and endpoints.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure Backblaze B2 as an S3-compatible backup storage destination, including setting up application keys and mapping credentials.

documents.title: Mongo Compass | Dokploy
documents.description: This guide will cover how to configure a Mongo Compass connection for your applications in dokploy or panel.
documents.summary: This guide provides step-by-step instructions for configuring external connections to MongoDB instances within Dokploy and connecting via MongoDB Compass.

documents.title: Redis | Dokploy
documents.description: This guide will cover how to connect from RedisInsight to your redis databases in dokploy.
documents.summary: This guide provides step-by-step instructions for connecting RedisInsight to a Redis database hosted on Dokploy using external connection credentials.

documents.title: PG Admin | Dokploy
documents.description: This guide will cover how to connect from pgAdmin to your postgres databases in dokploy.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions on how to connect pgAdmin to a Postgres database hosted on Dokploy by configuring external credentials and server settings.

documents.title: Webhook | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure webhook notifications for your applications.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up, test, and manage webhook notifications in Dokploy to receive real-time event updates via JSON payloads.

documents.title: Example | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to use Docker Compose with Dokploy
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to deploy applications using Docker Compose in Dokploy, specifically detailing manual network and domain configuration using Traefik labels.

documents.title: Auth0 | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure SSO with Auth0 (OIDC or SAML)
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring SAML-based Single Sign-On (SSO) between Auth0 and Dokploy, including application setup, provider configuration, and attribute mapping.

documents.title: Build Type | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn about the different build types available in Dokploy, including Nixpacks, Dockerfile, and Buildpack options.
documents.summary: This document explains the various build methods available in Dokploy, detailing the configuration options for Nixpacks, Railpack, Dockerfile, Buildpacks, and static site deployments.

documents.title: Discord | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure discord notifications for your applications.
documents.summary: This guide provides instructions for setting up and configuring Discord webhook notifications within the Dokploy panel to receive real-time application alerts.

documents.description: This section outlines how to configure free HTTP domains for your applications in Dokploy, ensuring that your applications are accessible via custom URLs.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring free HTTP domains in Dokploy using traefik.me and explains the difference between container ports and exposed ports.

documents.title: Email | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure email notifications for your applications.
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up email notifications in the Dokploy panel by configuring SMTP server details and recipient addresses. It details the specific fields required to receive updates about important application events.

documents.title: Slack | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure slack notifications for your applications.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Slack notifications in Dokploy to receive real-time updates on application events via webhooks.

documents.description: Configure a Digital Ocean Container Registry to store your images and artifacts.
documents.summary: This document provides step-by-step instructions for configuring and connecting a Digital Ocean Container Registry to Dokploy using API tokens and Docker credentials.

documents.description: This guide will cover how to connect from Beekeeper Studio to your mariadb databases in dokploy.
documents.summary: This guide provides instructions for establishing a connection between Beekeeper Studio and a MariaDB database hosted on Dokploy using external connection credentials.

documents.title: Going Production | Dokploy
documents.description: Learn how to deploy your application in production in Dokploy.
documents.summary: This document explains how to optimize application deployment in Dokploy for production environments by using external CI/CD pipelines to reduce server resource consumption and implementing zero-downtime strategies.

documents.title: Telegram | Dokploy
documents.description: Configure telegram notifications for your applications.

documents.description: Configure Lark notifications for your applications.
